title.native: ダンジョンに出会いを求めるのは間違っているだろうかⅣ 新章 迷宮篇
title.romaji: Dungeon ni Deai wo Motomeru no wa Machigatteiru Darou ka IV: Shin Shou Meikyuu-hen
title.english: Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon? IV

description:
The fourth season of Dungeon ni Deai wo Motomeru no wa Machigatteiru Darou ka.

Intrepid adventurer Bell Cranel has leveled up, but he can’t rest on his dungeoneering laurels just yet. The Hestia Familia still has a long way to go before it can stand toe-to-toe with the other Familias of Orario — but before Bell can set out on his next mission, reports of a brutal murder rock the adventuring community! One of Bell’s trusted allies stands accused of the horrible crime, and it’s up to Bell and his friends to clear their name and uncover a nefarious plot brewing in the dungeon’s dark depths.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)
synonyms: มันผิดรึไงถ้าใจอยากจะพบรักในดันเจี้ยน ภาค 4
Dungeon ni Deai wo Motomeru no wa Machigatteiru Darou ka 4th Season
Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon? Season 4
Liệu Có Sai Lầm Khi Tìm Kiếm Cuộc Gặp Gỡ Định Mệnh Trong Hầm Ngục? IV: Chương Mới Phần Mê Cung

tags.name: Dungeon
tags.description: Prominently features a dungeon environment.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Mermaid
tags.description: A mythological creature with the body of a human and the tail of a fish.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fujinoomori)

Fujino Oomori is a Japanese author most known for writing the [Danmachi](https://anilist.co/manga/85162/Is-It-Wrong-to-Try-to-Pick-Up-Girls-in-a-Dungeon/) light novel series. 

In early 2013, [Danmachi](https://anilist.co/manga/85162/Is-It-Wrong-to-Try-to-Pick-Up-Girls-in-a-Dungeon/) was submitted to the 4th GA Bunko Award, where it won and received an offer to have it published by Bunko.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzupin) | [Tumblr](https://suzupin.tumblr.com/)

Yasuda began drawing when he was 19 years old, after being inspired by [Range Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/98445/Range-Murata)'s pictures. As an illustrator he usually works with novels, providing the cover art and illustrations. He also makes logo designs for companies and games.  He also works on Range Murata's Robot, where he did the chapters: "Ebony & Ivory (Volume 1 & 2)" and "Minus R (Volume 4)"; despite having different names they are part of the same storyline.

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/), where he is one of the studio's leading animators. His drawing corrections as animation director are known for his advanced drawing skills. Additionally, he is occasionally entrusted with powerful character acting and action sequences.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fujinoomori)

Fujino Oomori is a Japanese author most known for writing the [Danmachi](https://anilist.co/manga/85162/Is-It-Wrong-to-Try-to-Pick-Up-Girls-in-a-Dungeon/) light novel series. 

In early 2013, [Danmachi](https://anilist.co/manga/85162/Is-It-Wrong-to-Try-to-Pick-Up-Girls-in-a-Dungeon/) was submitted to the 4th GA Bunko Award, where it won and received an offer to have it published by Bunko.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).
Keiji Inai is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with the music production company IMAGINE.

__[Website](https://whv-amusic.com/sajounohana/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sajounohana)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sajounohana/)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/JPN_sajou-no-hana-192527894722117/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCleWyL3f1xJU3Huj7NzRE5Q)__

__Formed:__ 2018
__Genres:__ Rock (Alternative), Shoegazer, Anison

__Biography:__
sajou no hana is a Japanese three-piece rock band under record label Warner Brothers Home Entertainment (2018-). Their singer initially debuted in 2016 as the vocalist of the seiyuu collaboration [MOB CHOIR](https://anilist.co/staff/161167/Mob-Choir) under the name 37, who performed the opening theme to the first season of [Mob Psycho 100](https://anilist.co/anime/21507/Mob-Psycho-100/).

__Members:__
- [sana](https://anilist.co/staff/296329) (さな) - vocalist
- [Sho Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/109345) (渡辺翔) - keyboardist, in-charge of lyrics, composition, arrangement and programming
- [Tatsuya Kitani](https://anilist.co/staff/161639/Tatsuya-Kitani) (キタニタツヤ) - guitarist and bassist, in-charge of lyrics, composition, arrangement and programming

(Source: [Wikipedia (sajou no hana)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sajou_no_hana), edited)

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Profile](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=74) | [Website](https://hayamisaoriofficial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayami_official)  | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtUcK6HrhD024CkPDsURBwg) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hayamisaori_official/)

Member of the duet [Blue Drops](https://anilist.co/staff/106305/Blue-Drops) with [Hitomi Yoshida](https://anilist.co/staff/101088/Hitomi-Yoshida).

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- Elisanne (Dragalia Lost)
- Kamisato Ayaka (Genshin Impact)
- Munechika (Utawarerumono)
- Pramanix (Arknights)
- Rei Shijo (Princess Connect! Re:Dive)
- Tao Isonokami (Shin Megami Tensei V)
- Vector (Girls' Frontline)
- Shimakaze (Azur Lane)
- Kirifuji Nagisa (Blue Archive)
- Kunimitsu II (Tekken 7)
- Emma Millstein (The Legend of Heroes Series)
- Hulkenberg (Metaphor: ReFantazio)
- Caeda (Fire Emblem Heroes)
